title: Hurricane Melissa barrels through the Caribbean
summary: From the ESA Blogs.
detailed_news: The image was captured by the Copernicus Sentinel-3 mission on 26 October 2025. It shows the ‘brightness temperature’ at the top of Hurricane Melissa as it barrelled through the Caribbean Sea. The temperature of the surrounding ocean is much warmer, reaching as high as 25°C.

title: Watch live: Sentinel-1D launch on Ariane 6
summary: The Copernicus Sentinel-1 mission is about to get its fourth satellite, with Sentinel-1D now ready for liftoff. Launch will take place with an Ariane 6 rocket from Kourou, French Guiana and live coverage will be shown on Tuesday, 4 November, at 22:03 CET (18:03 at Kourou).
detailed_news: Launch will take place with an Ariane 6 rocket from Kourou, French Guiana. Watch live on ESA Web TV on Tuesday, 4 November 2025 (all times in CET) The Sentinel-1 mission delivers radar images of Earth’s surface, performing in all weathers, day-and-night.

title: Launch Roundup: China to launch crew to Tiangong, India to launch new naval satellite
summary:
Six missions comprise the worldwide launch manifest this week, including a crewed launch from China…
The post Launch Roundup: China to launch crew to Tiangong, India to launch new naval satellite appeared first on NASASpaceFlight.com.
detailed_news: Six missions comprise the worldwide launch manifest this week, including a crewed launch from China and a new naval satellite for the Indian Navy. SpaceX is set to kick off the week with three back-to-back Starlink missions from its pads in California and Florida. Later in the week, China will launch the crewed Shenzhou 21 mission to the Tiangong space station. Starlink Group 11-23 is set to launch from SLC-4E at Vandenberg on Thursday, Oct. 30. 28 Starlink v2 Mini satellites will be launched into a 53.16-degree-inclination LEO. Falcon booster B1063 will support the mission, flying on its 29th mission after a 32-day turnaround. The final Falcon 9 mission of the week is scheduled to be the rideshare Bandwagon-4 mission. The Indian Space Research Organization (ISRO) is scheduled to launch the CMS-03 mission atop its Launch Vehicle Mark-3 (LVM-3) rocket on Sunday, Nov. 2, at 10:30 UTC. The payload on this mission is the GSAT-7R satellite, specifically designed for the Indian Navy. This mission will mark the 140th Falcon 9 mission of 2025, and SpaceX’s 585th mission of all time.

title: Sentinel-1D encapsulated inside Ariane 6 fairing
summary: From the ESA Blogs.
detailed_news: The Copernicus Sentinel-1D satellite has been encapsulated inside the Ariane 6 fairing at Europe's Spaceport in French Guiana. The mission operates in all weathers, day-and-night, to deliver high-resolution radar images of Earth’s surface.

title: Melissa set to be the strongest hurricane to ever strike Jamaica
summary: Storm reached sustained winds of 160 mph on Monday morning.
detailed_news: Storm reached sustained winds of 160 mph on Monday morning. Storm will make landfall in southern Jamaica less than 24 hours from now. Will almost certainly be the strongest tropical system to strike Jamaica in more than 150 years of records. Storm also poses lesser threats to Hispaniola, the Bahamas, and potentially Bermuda down the line.

summary:

detailed_news: ArianeGroup will transfer responsibility for Ariane 6 Vinci upper-stage engines from Vernon, France, to Lampoldshausen, Germany. The agreement, signed on 24 October, will also see the transfer of responsibility for the development of theAriane 6 oxygen turbopump from Avio’s headquarters in Colleferro to Vernon.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from California
summary: This will be the 98th launch of Starlink satellites in 2025. SpaceX is targeting liftoff of the Starlink 11-21 mission from pad 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base, California, at 2:12 p.m. PDT (5:12 p.m. EDT / 2112 UTC).
detailed_news: The Starlink 11-21 mission will add another 28 more of the V2 Mini iteration of the satellites into low Earth orbit. An on-time liftoff would break the record for the fastest pad turnaround for SpaceX’s West Coast launch pad. The company has already set turnaround records this month on both coasts. This will be its 17th flight following USSF-62, NROL-145, OneWeb Launch 20 and 13 batches of Starlink satellites.

title: What’s Happening in Space Policy October 26-November 1, 2025
summary: Here is SpacePolicyOnline.com’s list of space policy events for the week of October 26-November 1, 2025 and any insight we can offer about them.  The Senate is in session this […]
detailed_news: SpacePolicyOnline.com's list of space policy events for the week of October 26-November 1, 2025. The Senate is in session this week. The House continues to be in recess indefinitely except for pro forma sessions. Both sides are wagering the public will blame the other as federal workers and contractors increase their credit card debt. JAXA launched the first of its new HTV cargo ships, HTV-X1, to the ISS. It will dock at the ISS on Wednesday. Another Russian spacewalk will take place the day before (Tuesday) China is getting ready to launch a new crew, Shenzhou-21, to their Tiangong-3.  Daylight Saving Time ends in the United States next Sunday morning at 2:00 am. Europe and the UK “fell back” today to Central European Time (CET) and Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) Those and other events we know about as of Sunday morning are shown below. Check back throughout the week for others we learn about later and add to our Calendar.

title: JAXA’s HTV-X1 set to launch to ISS aboard H3 Rocket
summary:
The Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) is set to launch its advanced HTV-X1 cargo spacecraft…
The post JAXA’s HTV-X1 set to launch to ISS aboard H3 Rocket appeared first on NASASpaceFlight.com.
detailed_news: The Japan Aerospace Exploration Agency (JAXA) is set to launch its advanced HTV-X1 cargo spacecraft to the International Space Station (ISS) from the Yoshinobu Launch Complex at Tanegashima Space Center on Sunday. The launch had been delayed for days due to poor weather at the picturesque launch site. The mission will utilize JAXA’s H3-24L rocket. The HTV-X1 is designed to deliver cargo to Gateway, a planned lunar-orbiting space station in a near-rectilinear halo orbit. JAXA is also contributing to Gateway through the International Habitation (I-Hab) module, developed in collaboration with the European Space Agency. The H3 rocket debuted in March 2023 with the launch of the 3.7-tonne ALOS-3 satellite.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Cape Canaveral
summary: This will be the 230th launch of Starlink V2 Mini satellites to date. SpaceX is targeting liftoff of the Starlink 10-21 mission from pad 40 at Cape Canaveral Space Force Station during a window that opens at 10:05 a.m. EDT (1405 UTC).
detailed_news: SpaceX is preparing for a Sunday morning Falcon 9 launch from Cape Canaveral Space Force Station to fly more of its Starlink broadband internet satellites into low Earth orbit. The 45th Weather Squadron forecast a 85 percent chance for favorable weather at the opening of the window, but noted that it decreases to 70 percent favorability as the window progresses. The primary concern for meteorologists are cumulus clouds.

The project, which, while not officially named, has been referred to by media sources as Project Bromo, would combine […]

detailed_news: Airbus, Thales, and Leonardo have signed a memorandum of understanding to combine their space businesses into a single company. Trade unions representing the affected workers have given mixed reactions to the news. The sharpest criticism came from FTM-CGT, the metalworkers’ federation of the Confédération générale du travail. title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch 28 Starlink satellites on Falcon 9 rocket from Vandenberg SFB
summary: The mission is poised to featured the 160th landing of a booster on the drone ship, ‘Of Course I Still Love You’. Liftoff from pad 4E at Vandenberg Space Force Base is scheduled for 7:20 a.m. PDT (10:20 a.m. EDT / 1420 UTC).
detailed_news: The Starlink 11-12 mission will add another 28 broadband satellites to the constellation of more than 8,700 spacecraft in low Earth orbit. This will be its 135 Falcon 9 launch of 2025, breaking its record number of orbital launches achieved in all of 2024. The mission comes nearly a week after SpaceX launched its 10,000th Starlink satellite to date.

title: Starbase Pad 1 ends an era, enters preparations for the next phase
summary:
After 11 Flights and many tests, the booster test stand turned launch mount has reached…
The post Starbase Pad 1 ends an era, enters preparations for the next phase appeared first on NASASpaceFlight.com.
detailed_news: Pad 1 began construction in July 2020, when crews started laying the foundation for the six legs of the launch mount. The mount itself was built at the production site, then rolled to the launch site and installed on the legs on July 31, 2021. Pad 1 propelled the Starship program through the early years and now moves towards the new phase of operations. The booster test stand turned launch mount has reached the end of its life. The first-ever static fire on Pad 1 occurred on Aug 9, 2022, with a single engine test from Booster 7. The first stack of the first set of actual flight vehicles occurred on Oct 11, 2022. A Wet Dress Rehearsal was completed with Booster 7 and Ship 24 on Jan 23, 2023. A full-duration 10-second 33 engine static fire wouldn’t occur until Aug 25, 20 23, with Booster 9. Pad 1 performed 28 cryogenic proof and tanking tests, 15 spin primes, 34 static fires, six wet dress rehearsals, four aborted launch attempts, and 11 Full Stack flight tests. The quickest turnaround time for Pad 1 was 37 days between Flight 5 and Flight 6.

title: Second Space Resources Challenge: from concept to reality at LUNA
summary: Last year, ESA invited innovators across Europe to join the second Space Resources Challenge, a competition designed to accelerate technologies that will help humankind live and work sustainably on the Moon.
detailed_news: ESA invited innovators across Europe to join the second Space Resources Challenge. The challenge is designed to accelerate technologies that will help humankind live and work sustainably on the Moon. Last week, eight teams demonstrated robotic systems capable of collecting and processing lunar soil. The winning team is expected to be announced at the end of November. Team ASTROLITH developed Kirb-e, a robotic system built for Moon-like conditions designed to dig and sort lunar soil. Using a rover equipped with rotating shovels, the team successfully collected and processed large quantities of regolith simulant. The material was then funneled into a rotary sieve to separate it by particle size. The rover collects lunar soil using a rotating tube, which also acts as the internal storage in which it remains. To reduce the risk of dust interfering with moving parts, they sealed the chassis and minimised exposed mechanisms. Although they faced challenges with motor drivers and software integration, the team was proud to complete and test their system.

title: Focusing on NGC 3370
summary: From the ESA Blogs.
detailed_news: The galaxy is called NGC 3370, and it is a spiral galaxy located nearly 90 million light-years away in the constellation Leo(The Lion) It is home to two kinds of objects that astronomers prize for their usefulness in determining distances to faraway galaxies: Cepheid variable stars and Type Ia supernovae.

summary:

Ownership will be shared among the three parent firms, with Leonardo and Thales each holding a 32.5% stake, and Airbus holding the majority stake of 35%. The new company, which will […]
The post Airbus, Thales, and Leonardo Agree to Create European Space Behemoth appeared first on European Spaceflight.
detailed_news: Airbus, Leonardo, and Thales have signed a memorandum of understanding to combine their respective space businesses into a single new company. Ownership will be shared among the three parent firms, with Leonardo each holding a 32.5% stake, and Airbus holding the majority stake of 35%. The new company, which will employ approximately 25,000 people, will be managed jointly under a “balanced governance structure”

The new, yet-to-be-named company aims to come online in 2027, pending regulatory approval and other logistics. Airbus would own a majority of this new venture with a 35 percent stake. Aschbacher said he is not “concerned in terms of diversity and competition” “We will certainly adapt to the new situation. We will support them in their buildup of the new company,” he said. The launch will be managed by Arianespace and will carry the third satellite for the Optical Space Component.

title: NASA leadership battle intensifies as Trump weighs Isaacman vs. Duffy
summary:
A high-stakes contest for NASA’s next permanent Administrator is unfolding, pitting billionaire private astronaut Jared…
The post NASA leadership battle intensifies as Trump weighs Isaacman vs. Duffy appeared first on NASASpaceFlight.com.
detailed_news: Jared Isaacman is a billionaire entrepreneur, two-time private astronaut, and philanthropist known for raising over $250 million for St. Jude Children’s Research Hospital during the Inspiration4 mission. Isaacman cleared a significant hurdle on April 9, 2025, passing the Senate Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation with a 19-9 vote. But political turbulence derailed the process. NASA was left with Petro as Acting Administrator and no permanent replacement in sight. In a surprising turn, Trump appointed Secretary of Transportation Sean Duffy as NASA’s new Acting Administrator in July 2025. Duffy, a close ally of the President, received unexpected support from Isaacman, who even flew Duffy in his MiG-29 fighter jet.

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to expend Falcon 9 booster to launch Spainsat NG 2 communications satellite
summary: The SpainSat NG 2 satellite will be flown to a geosynchronous transfer orbit. Liftoff is scheduled during a four-hour window that opens at 9:30 p.m. EDT (0130 UTC).
detailed_news: A SpaceX Falcon 9 first stage flew Thursday for the 21st and final time. The rocket wasn’t fitted with landing legs or grid fins as they were not needed. This was the 134th orbital launch of 2025 for SpaceX, tying the total number of launches it achieved for all of 2024. The launch was originally scheduled for Wednesday night, but was delayed 24 hours for reasons not disclosed. SpaceX's first full-size stainless steel Starship test vehicle stands some 164 feet tall and measures wider than the cabin of a Boeing 747 jumbo jet. If Elon Musk has his way, it will fly to an altitude of 65,000 feet before the end of the year. SpaceX launched a Falcon 9 rocket with 60 Starlink internet satellites.

title: Avio Shareholders Approve €400M Capital Increase
summary:
Avio shareholders approved a proposal to initiate a €400 million capital increase during an extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on Thursday. The company’s board was also delegated the authority to execute a future capital raise without seeking further shareholder approval. The Italian rocket builder announced in early September that its board had approved the capital raise as […]
The post Avio Shareholders Approve €400M Capital Increase appeared first on European Spaceflight.
detailed_news: Avio shareholders approved a proposal to initiate a €400 million capital increase during an extraordinary shareholders’ meeting on Thursday. The company’s board was also delegated the authority to execute a future capital raise without seeking further shareholder approval. Under the approved proposal, Avio will have 12 months to complete the capital raise.

title: The astronaut who filmed the Dream is Alive
summary:
In this episode of Space Minds, host David Ariosto speaks with Terry Hart, former NASA astronaut and mission specialist on the Space Shuttle Challenger. Hart reflects on the triumphs of early shuttle missions, the lessons of the Challenger tragedy, and how those experiences shape today’s commercial space era led by companies like SpaceX and Blue Origin.
The post The astronaut who filmed the Dream is Alive appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: The next space race will be won at night

authors.name: Alan Campbell, A.C. Charania, Tim Crain and Elizabeth Kryst

summary:
The first space race was about getting to the moon. Today’s race to the moon and Mars is about staying there.
The post The next space race will be won at night appeared first on SpaceNews.

title: Earth from space: Likouala-aux-Herbes river, Congo
summary: From the ESA Blogs.
detailed_news: This Copernicus Sentinel-2 image captures the meandering course of the Likouala-aux-Herbes river in the Republic of the Congo. The region is covered with permanent swamp and marsh, dense forests and grassland, which also explains the origin of the river’s name, meaning 'grassy river'

title: FutureEO at ESA’s Ministerial Council 2025
summary: The European Space Agency’s Council at Ministerial Level is the time for bold vision and decisive action. In November, ESA’s Member States, Associate States, and Cooperating States will unite to elevate Europe’s role in space and secure its continued leadership for the benefit of citizens.
detailed_news: The European Space Agency’s Council at Ministerial Level is the time for bold vision and decisive action. FutureEO is a driving force for innovation and excellence across satellite missions, Earth system science and Earth action. To date, seven Earth Explorer missions have been launched successfully. FutureEO will be structured around three pillars: Foundations, Missions and Data, and Earth Action. The Foundations pillar is the engine that powers every future Earth observation mission. It lays the groundwork for science, technology and mission preparation. The Earth Action pillar turns Earth observation into real-world impact, delivering benefits for science and society. The Next Generation Gravity Mission will provide unmatched insight into how ‘mass’ moves within the Earth system. WIVERN is the eleventh mission to be selected for implementation as an Earth Explorer. The Climate Change Initiative , EO for Society and the Global Development Assistance element will now be integrated into Earth Action.

title: Wrapping up a record-breaking edition of ESA Open Days 2025
summary: From the ESA Blogs.
detailed_news: The 2025 edition of ESA Open Days began at ESA’s European Space Operations Centre (ESOC) in Darmstadt on 12 September. Visitors had the unique opportunity to step inside ESA and discover how space science and innovation are shaping our future. For the first time, on 20 September ESA Headquarters in Paris hosted a full-scale Open Day. The 2025 edition of the ESA Open Days concluded at ESA’s largest establishment, ESTEC in the Netherlands, on 11 and 12 October. Nearly 10 000 attendees engaged with ESA astronauts and experts in space exploration, engineering, and science. Highlights included exhibits on missions such as PLATO and Proba-3, presentations in the Erasmus Auditorium, access to the Test Centre.
